channel.title: Haeundae-gu on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Learn the life of passion from red blossoms 'Busan Haeundae Dongbaek Island' - Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea
item.description:
Dove with heart-shaped camellia

Learn the life of passion from red blossoms 'Busan Haeundae Dongbaek Island'

Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

Singer Cho Yong-pil sang. 'Flower camellia'. The camellia flowers that passed the peak of the season are covered in the trail at Dongbaek Park on Dongbaek Island next to Haeundae in Busan. The summit of Dongbaek Island, where the statue of Choi Chi-won was erected, is the flower palace. Dongbaek Park is a camellia tree along the ring road. Learn the passionate life posture from the intensely red blossoms. However, the camellia falls without hesitation in the spring breeze blowing across the Pacific Ocean. The spring day is flowing so unfortunately.

If there are Camellia Hill in Jeju Island, Camellia Hill in Jeju Island, Jisimdo Island in Yeosu, Camellia Forest in Maryangri in Seocheon, and Camellia Forest in Okryongsaji in Gwangyang, Dongbaek Island in Haeundae-gu is the best place to visit. When you get off at Dongbaek Station or Haeundae Station on Busan Subway Line 2, you will soon reach Dongbaek Island, where camellia flowers have formed a cushion of flowers. If the spring breeze that wraps around the skyscrapers in Haeundae or Suyeong River blows a little from behind, the steps become lighter.
Camellia flower with multicolored and shape
It looks like an iron, because it looks like an iron. As the name suggests, Dongbaekseom was originally an island. The island has been connected to the land due to the sedimentation of many years. These islands are called 'yukgyido'.
Camellia flower with multicolored and shape
The walking tour of Dongbaek Island is in front of the Westin Chosun Busan Hotel. At the entrance, there is a guide map of Dongbaek Park and a sign indicating the origin of Haeundae Dongbaek Island, which is a good guide for beginners. No matter which side you start walking on, you need to set the direction as you go. Most of the Nurimaru APEC (Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation) houses turn to the right. This will keep the sea on the right hand side of the island.
Camellia flower with multicolored and shape
The faces of people walking on the Dongbaekseom loopway are consistently 'Yu-Yu-Ju-Yu'. Whether you are a citizen who lives in the air of Busan every day, a traveler on a KTX or Saemaul train, or a group of tourists from Southeast Asia, they walk the trails at their own pace and pace. Because the car does not go, the couple pushing the stroller is also noticeable. When various types of camellia flowers, such as Camellia, Camellia, and Camellia, pass under a tree hanging like an apple, they stop and take photos. It's too short for each person's chest, so it's a sad spring day.
Dongbaek Island West Promenade

On the trail of Dongbaek Island, you cannot find camellia flowers that fell on the road. I turned my head and looked inside the fence, and they all gathered there. This is because the people who clean the trails sweep the camellia flowers that have fallen to the ground with people's sneakers or shoehorns, sweeping them with a broomstick that looks like they might scream. There is a brilliant tomb of Camellia. So camellia blooms twice. Once, it hangs on a tree and blooms in full bloom. When it dies, it does not scatter one leaf and two leaves, but it falls apart and blooms once more. People love the camellia flower because it has a thick line like this and does not act obsessively to prolong life. At this point, I think of a time when Seongsammun, a Bachelor of Jeon Hyun-jeon during King Sejong in Joseon, made a camellia flower.

I love the middle of winter
It's the best time to half-fill.
I'm afraid that it will bloom when I haven't
If it blooms, it will wither away
-From Ki Tae-wan, 《Flowers, Look In》

Dongbaekseom Promenade Falls
Steps suddenly reach the Nurimaru APEC House. As soon as you step inside, it is Kim Kyu-jang's masterpiece <Twelve Jangsaengdo>. This is a Najeon lacquer painting that adds two things to a teenager, and it is very large (6m × 2.2m) and colorful. Let's look at each one that appears. Sun, clouds, mountains, rocks, water, cranes, deer, turtles, pine trees, and bullochos have been added to bamboo and nectarine peaches to become twelve. When I visited it before, I just passed by, but this spring, I open it one by one, so I feel the flow of time.
Nurimaru seen from the observation deck
Nurimaru, which introduced Korea's traditional concept of pavilion, has a good view from the observation deck with a small lighthouse. On the right, you can see Gwangan Bridge and Igidae Park at a glance with a round roof of Nurimaru, on the left, and the sea and the back. It is 500 meters from the entrance of Dongbaekseom Island and is boldly marked with white paint at the bottom of the road. On the Observation Deck, a photographer is taking a commemorative photo of travelers who have not brought a camera.
Nurimaru's 12th birthday
A telescope is also installed on the observation deck. Oryukdo (6 islands at high tide and 5 at low tide) is floating in front of the nose. Let's take a look at what is written on the observation deck information board.

It is estimated that the average Tsushima Island can be seen in Busan on average 60 days a year. There is a theory that "the Tsushima Island seen from Busan is likely to be a kind of mirage caused by the refraction of light caused by the difference in temperature between regions."

Observation deck with telescope

Which theory is correct? Another signboard stands next to it. The title is ‘Boilak Malak Tsushima Secret’. It's fun to read every single line without looking at it. "The distance between Busan and Tsushima is 65km, but the fact that the entire coastline is visible, even if the weather is clear, exceeds the limits of human vision, and is likely to be a mirage," wrote an article in the Busan Daily.

Camellia flower and Haeundae
The Observation Deck is located at the turn point of Dongbaekseom Island. If you move your seat to a deck installed on a coastal cliff with a good view of Haeundae next door, you can find a stone carving called “Haeundae”. Designated as Busan National Monument No. 45, this stone carving is said to be written by Goun Choi Chi-won (857 ~?), A scholar and writer of the late Unified Silla.
East side of Dongbaek island
When a fine teacher went to Mt. Gaya in the last years, he passed through this place and left the word “Haeundae” on a large rock under the cliff against the beautiful scenery. The name continues to this day. The stone carvings seen between camellia trees are in a state where the luck is somewhat worn out after experiencing the weather for many years.
The appearance of a fallen camellia
A tattoo called Jeongpo (1309-1345) in the Goryeo Dynasty also left a number of poems after visiting Haeundae. "Dae is devastated and there is no trace, only the name of the shipping remains." It is a sign that it was called Haeundae 700 years ago.
Flowers
Even after turning around, the feast of camellia flowers continues. The acquaintance, who said, “If you want to feel the spring of Busan in full body, take a walk around Dongbaek Island,” was never empty. With the camellia forest on the right side and walking towards the starting point, a bad smell like a sewer irritates the nose. Some say it smells like chicken. It is the scent that spreads through the white flowers of Sasraepi amongst the camellia forest.
Waterside walking deck
Sasrefi trees grow on the coast of Dongbaek Island and bloom in March-April. Even if the smell is bad, it is not only a matter of passing through the nose to sterilize and calm down. A mermaid statue can be found along the waterfront walking deck along the coast below the promenade.
Mermaid statue
It is only 900m to the front of the Westin Chosun Busan Hotel, which was the starting point of one round trip around Dongbaek Island. Would a boxer say that he has just gotten warm? Go to the top of Dongbaek Island where the remains of the teacher Choi Chi-won are. The camellia forest is sloping to the left and right of the gentle hill road, and tall pine trees prevent the warm spring sunlight. When you reach the summit, there are octagonal pavilions called Haeunjeong and monuments to the left and right around the statue.
Haeunjeong
Camellia flowers are also in full bloom around the statue, blocking the noise and waves of the city. Gugudae only hears the sound of pigeons and the chirping of white-eyes. A bench sits on the edge around the park. Sitting on a shaded bench, I hear the sound of camellia flowers falling and the spring flowing. Goun Choi Chi-won heard this sound first and left a poem called <Spring Dawn> to posterity travelers.
Fine Chichiwon Statue

The flowing water can't come back
Spring light only torments people
The sad morning rain
Flowers bloom and bear, and they are fine.

Busan City Tour Bus
Travel information

Restaurants near
-Excellent Korean beef: Korean beef ribs / 49 Haeun-daero 570beon-gil, Haeundae-gu, Busan / 051-747-9900

http://www.ilpumhanwoo.kr/

-Jang Bak Sukjang Gopchang: Gopchang Grill / 102 Centum Pil 1, 102, Centum-dong-ro, Haeundae-gu, Busan / 051-782-0092


Rooms
-Rivero Hotel: 21, Gunam-ro 29beon-gil, Haeundae-gu, Busan / 051-740-2111

http://www.liberohotel.co.kr/

-Songjeong Tourist Hotel: 28 Songjeong Haebyeon-ro, Haeundae-gu, Busan / 051-702-7766

http://www.songjunghotel.co.kr/

-Busan Westin Chosun Hotel: 67 Dongbaek-ro, Haeundae-gu, Busan / 051-749-7000

https://twcb.echosunhotel.com/main.do



※ The above information was updated in February 2018, and may be changed later, so be sure to check it before you travel.

item.title: Surfing trip between men, Songjeong Beach, Busan - Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea
item.description:
Local surfer surfing at Songjeong Beach

Surfing trip between men, Songjeong Beach, Busan

Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

Surfing is no longer the subject of a movie or a longing. Yangyang, Taean, and Pohang have already established themselves as surf spots. What's the theme of this, because men are building strong friendships? In particular, the Songjeong Beach in Busan is suitable for beginners, making it perfect for first surfing.
Man travel, friendship and challenge surfing!
For several years, the fever of tvn <Youth over Flowers> has been strong. The ringing was loud for the cast and men in their 20s and 40s. In the meantime, there were many bad trips (?) For men's trips. However, <Youth over Flowers> harmonized with men's sticky friendship and the theme of 'challenge', dreaming of a healthy trip with friends.
Songjeong Beach, popular as a surf spot as well as a beach
Surfing satisfies both themes of 'friendship' and 'challenge'. Surfing in Hawaii or the Gold Coast is a misunderstanding if you think that surfing on the Internet is only a matter of other countries. There are more surf spots in Korea than I thought, including Yangyang Jukdo, Taean Manripo, Pohang Chilpo, and Jeju Jungmun. The equipment is also simple and relatively easy to access. It is no longer left as one of the bucket lists. It will be a challenge to meet your friends. There is nothing better than this, as we learn together and build up friendships.
Surfholic's exterior where you can learn to surf at Songjeong Beach
Among them, Busan Songjeong Beach is a good place to start surfing. Since the South Sea and the East Sea meet, the south swell from spring to summer and the northeast swell in winter can enjoy surfing in all seasons. In addition, the waves of the knee are frequent and the lessons are conducted at the depth of the waist, making it perfect for beginners to surf. Currently, about 10 surf schools and equipment rental companies have entered the beach. Local surfers have already emerged since the late 1990s, and almost 20 years have passed. International surfing competitions have been held since 2009. It is worthwhile to be a mecca of surfing in Korea.
Surfboards on display at Surfholic
Surfing, there is an entrance, but there is no exit
For lessons, use surfing schools such as Surfholic and Songjeong Surfing School around Songjeong Beach. Songjeong has been systematically taking classes since the first generation surfers in Korea took root. The course is generally divided into Day 1, Day 3, and Day 5.
Surfing lesson day 1 theoretical training
Day 1 is followed by theory, ground exercises, and practice of acquisition. The theory explains the title of each part of the board, the rules of surfing, and safety.
Day 1 surfers practicing paddling on the sandy beach
Ground exercises are conducted on sandy beaches. The basic movements of the surf are paddle padding to paddle with your arms when the waves come in, push-ups to raise your upper arms to reach the waves, and take-offs to raise your knees to the lower body, finally balancing and riding the waves Is divided into Repeat this motion on the sandy beach to wear it. It is boring, but the performance of practice is directly related to the practice. Of course, I usually realize this after a few bumps on the water.
Surfboard prevents loss by connecting with the leash cord of the surfer ankle
At first, the water practice is on the board with the help of the instructor, rather than speeding up with paddling. At this time, the position of the foot on the board, the gaze, and the process of quickly converting from push-up to take-off are important. Repeat this a few times and notice the timing of the waves. Quick learners stand on the board in two or three turns and ride the waves.
Push-up posture while standing on the surfboard
On the second day, start with paddling and practice climbing yourself. If the board focuses on going straight in by the 2nd day, from the 3rd day, challenge the side riding on the oblique side of the wave surface. Day 4-5 is the process of deepening what you have learned until day 3. The cost is around 65,000 won on the first day and 150,000 won on the third day, including equipment rental. Personal training is only possible after learning at least 3 days. Of course, after the 1st day experience, most of them continue until the 3rd day.
Surfers heading to the sea for surfing
Surfing is very special because it slides on the water. It is a pleasure that you have never felt before. It has a different charm than a snowboard running on a snowy field. It's hard to break up once you fall into the charm that flows like a fish over the waves. "Surfing is like a mob. Once you're in there, there's no exit," said Kelly Slater, former World Surfer (WSL) champion. Surfing is a passionate and fascinating report.
Surfboard as a symbol of Songjeong Beach
The class time is about 3 hours per day. Starting in June, you can overlap with the surfers, so you will teach in the surf zone. In the summer, there are many people who want to learn to surf, so it's a good idea to challenge before the peak season begins. Some companies, such as Surfholic, lend their equipment and help them practice personally even after the class is over until May.
You can ride the wave with only 1st day training
Surfing is not greatly affected by the weather. It is good to surf in the rain on a rainy day. You can't swim because you wear a buoyant suit. In addition, the surfboard is connected to the ankle with a leash cord, making it easy to manage underwater. Preparations include a swimsuit, light toiletries and sunscreen. Beginners are advised to make a reservation after confirming in advance as low tide time is safe. Children can challenge if they are over 135cm tall.
Surf training is relatively safe at shallow water
Trip to Busan, Walking along the tracks of Songjeong Station
After surfing, go to Songjeong Station on the East Sea Nambu Line at the entrance of the beach. Songjeong Station was opened in 1934 and was designated as a registered cultural property in 2006. In 2013, the Donghae Nambu Line reached its end of life and lost the function of the station. I can feel the faded time everywhere. Currently, it is operated as a citizen gallery. Works were installed inside and outside the station.
Permanent exhibition inside Songjeong Station
The Donghae Nambu Line has also been reborn as an old trail. It is 4.8km from Songjeong Station to Cheongsapo Saegil to Mipo Crossing. They go through short tunnels and walk while looking at the sea. Either from Songjeong Station or Mipo, it takes 40 minutes to Cheongsapo Saegil and the rest of the trip takes about 40 minutes. When walking is a burden, you can take a walk around Songjeong Station lightly.
Travelers walking on the old road of the Donghae Nambu Line
Travel info
